title: Power Bill Relief Central in Australia Budget, Treasurer Says
description: Relief for rising power bills in Australia will feature prominently in the May budget, but the government will focus on trying to control inflation, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said.

title: Canada Shoots Down 'Unidentified Object' That Violated Its Airspace
description: OTTAWA (AP) — Trudeau: Canada has shot down an 'unidentified object' that violated its airspace, day after US shootdown over Alaska.

title: Object Shot Down Over Canada in Escalating Aerial Drama
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau ordered the takedown of an unidentified airborne object over Canada on Saturday, the third such aerial incursion into North American airspace this month, prompting alarm across the continent.

title: US Recovery of Object Downed Over Alaska Faces Arctic Conditions
description: A US recovery effort on sea ice in Alaska continued Saturday after a fighter jet shot down an unidentified airborne object near the Canadian border.

title: Trump Team Handed Over More Classified Documents From Mar-a-Lago
description: Former President Donald Trump’s legal team turned over several pages of documents with classified markings and a laptop containing electronic scans of those materials to federal investigators in recent months, a person familiar with the situation said.

title: Belgian MEP Tarabella Charged With Money Laundering, Corruption
description: European lawmaker Marc Tarabella has been charged with corruption, money laundering, and the membership of a criminal organization by a Belgian investigating judge.

title: Coolant Leak at Russian Spacecraft, Station Crew Safe
description: MOSCOW (AP) — An uncrewed Russian supply ship docked at the International Space Station has lost coolant pressure, the Russian space corporation and NASA reported Saturday, saying the incident doesn’t pose any danger to the station’s crew.

title: Armenian Aid Trucks Enter Turkey for First Time in 30 Years
description: Armenian trucks crossed into Turkey for the first time in almost 30 years to deliver humanitarian aid to survivors following a pair of disastrous earthquakes this week.

title: The Middle East Is Shaken by Devastating Quakes: Weekend Reads
description: The death toll in the quakes that hit Turkey and Syria rose to more than 25,000, with tens of thousands left homeless, as Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan faces criticism for delays to relief efforts just months before planned elections.

title: Debt Ceiling Fight May Boost US Stocks, Says Pictet Fund Manager
description: For all the fretting about the political standoff over the US debt ceiling, one fund manager sees the deadlock providing a boost to the stock market.

title: Argentina’s Dominant Political Force Looks Into the Electoral Abyss
description: Two-times former president, Cristina Kirchner, is the architect of the Peronist coalition. She may be about to take it down with her.

title: Miracle Quake Survivors, Including Infant, Give Hope to Turkey
description: Turkey’s hopes have turned to miraculous survivors still being rescued after Monday’s devastating earthquakes in the nation’s southeast and Syria that killed over 25,000 people.

title: East Germany’s Last Communist Leader Dies at 95
description: The German Democratic Republic’s last communist leader, Hans Modrow, passed away on Friday at the age of 95.

title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Sunak Pivots Toward Closer EU Ties
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

title: Rishi Sunak Is Privately Drafting Plans to Rebuild Britain’s Ties With the EU
description: The war in Ukraine and Brexit acrimony is forcing a rethink that risks a backlash from hardcore Euroskeptics in the governing Conservative party.

title: Ukraine Latest: US Says Putin Weaponizing Energy With Oil Cut
description: Russia launched its biggest barrage of missile attacks against Ukraine so far this year, a day after President Volodymyr Zelenskiy completed a visit to European capitals, where he sought more weapons to fend off Vladimir Putin’s invasion.

title: French Unions Face Pivotal Test in Pension Showdown With Macron
description: France’s labor unions have called for a massive turnout on Saturday at protests across the country against raising the retirement age, in a key test of whether they can revive momentum against President Emmanuel Macron’s flagship reform.

title: 'The People of Knowsley Are Not Bigots': Anti-Refugee Protesters Condemned
description: Protesters who became violent outside a hotel housing asylum seekers in Merseyside have been condemned by police and MPs.

title: Quake Latest: Deaths Top 24,000; Rescuers Race Against Time
description: The death toll from earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria surpassed 24,000 as rescue workers continue the search for survivors.

title: Toronto Mayor John Tory Resigns After Relationship With Staffer
description: Toronto Mayor John Tory resigned on Friday after admitting to a relationship with a staffer.

title: Trump Lawyer in Mar-a-Lago Search Appeared Before Grand Jury
description: Evan Corcoran, one of Donald Trump’s lawyers, appeared before a federal grand jury last month as part of the special counsel investigation into whether classified information and other government records were mishandled at the former president’s Mar-a-Lago estate, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Archives Release Letters With Biden Attorney Over Secret Papers
description: The National Archives and Records Administration released dozens of emails Friday that show agency officials working with a personal lawyer for President Joe Biden to recover documents discovered at Biden’s think tank.

title: What Life is Like in Crisis-Hit Pakistan as Inflation Soars
description: As Pakistan lurches from one crisis to another, citizens are taking to the streets to protest a duel economic and political meltdown with little precedent in the nation’s post-independence history.
